text.annotators: Natalia Bogomolova, Dmitry Ganenkov, Nils Schiborr
text.speaker: TS01

unit.utterance: q’uˁr dustː axnu.
unit.utterance_translation: There were two friends.

unit.utterance: sar maz̊gliʔin, sarsana axnu ʁaˁrac’an.ǯi.
unit.utterance_translation: One was in Mezhgul and the other was in Qaratsan.

unit.utterance: maz̊gliʔin alir.in c̊ur vu nüraˤli, ʁaˁrac’an.ǯi ajir.in rabadan.
unit.utterance_translation: The name of the one from Mezhgul is Nurali, that of the one from Qaratsan is Rabadan.

unit.utterance: murar lap juk’ʷ ali dustːar vuǯi axnu.
unit.utterance_translation: They were very close friends.

unit.utterance: sar sar.ixna ʁuˁri aˁri, χaˁluz̊val ap’uri, ajib paj ap’uri, huˁrmat ap’uri, sar sar.iqǯi dusri ʁuduʒ̊uri, gizaf uǯudar juk’ʷ ali dustːar vuǯi šulu.
unit.utterance_translation: They go to visit each other, they share what they have, they show respect, they sit and stand up together, they are very good and close friends.

unit.utterance: hacːib vaχtː vuji.
unit.utterance_translation: The time was so.

unit.utterance: sab vaχtna maz̊glar.i nüraˤli ktaʁuru zamina ʁaravul.ǯi ʁul.an.
unit.utterance_translation: Once the inhabitants of Mezhgul elected Nurali to be reliable guard for the village.

unit.utterance: zamina ʁaravul ʁapigan, značit hamu ʁul.an vari har sab χl.a aji, značit, šej.nan ejsival ap’uru uduq’ruru dupnu, nürälikan ap’uru zamina ʁaravul.
unit.utterance_translation: "Reliable guard" means that he can protect ownership of things in every house of the village; they made Nurali reliable guard.

unit.utterance: hamu vaχtːna značit mu ʁul.aʔ šulu sab haˁdisa.
unit.utterance_translation: At that time there happens an episode in this village.

unit.utterance: ʁaˁrac’an.ǯiz liχuz ʁušu ʁulandar.i, šaˁjb.nu, rabadan.ǯin χpːir.in kamar hiči<b>k’nu ʁuˁru hatlin.
unit.utterance_translation: A village inhabitant who went to work to Qaratsan, Shaban, stole a silver belt from Rabadan's wife and came back from there.

unit.utterance: ʁafige kamar hiči<b>k’nu, sar.izk’a darpiǯi muvu ǯiniǯi ʁitu čan χl.a uˁ<b>χ uˁraǯi šulu.
unit.utterance_translation: When he stole it and came back, he tells nobody and keeps (the belt) secretly in his house.

unit.utterance: rabadan.ǯiz χabar šuldar q’an.az.
unit.utterance_translation: Rabadan knows nothing for a long time.

unit.utterance: qa ligu... sab vaχtːna χabar abxi rabadan liguru, fikir ap’uru, fuž u kamar hič’i<b>k’uru, šlixa ap’uz šulu mu laˁχin.
unit.utterance_translation: Rabadan, who found it out at some point, looks and thinks about who has stolen the belt and who could have done this.

unit.utterance: aˁχir rabadan ʁav.ri aqru.
unit.utterance_translation: Finally, Rabadan figures it out.

unit.utterance: vallah k’uru, mu šl.ivušra ʁap’nuki maz̊glar.i ʁap’nu.
unit.utterance_translation: I swear, he says, whoever did it, inhabitants of Mezhgul did it.

unit.utterance: χabar naʔna χabar, značit maz̊glar.ikan.
unit.utterance_translation: What are we talking about, we are talking about the inhabitants of Mezhgul [lit. where is the news, it is about the inhabitants of Mezhgul, a traditional locution in narratives].

unit.utterance: qana ʁaˁrac’an.ǯiz liχuz ʁušu, ʁaˁru bačan.
unit.utterance_translation: And then Bachan goes to work to Qaratsan and comes.

unit.utterance: ʁušu bačn.az k’uru rabadan.ǯi, ma uvuz pul, uvu ʁiliχub gerek adar.
unit.utterance_translation: Rabadan told Bachan, who had come: "Here is money, there is no need for you to work.

unit.utterance: ʁaraχ ʁul.az, hamcːib kamar dudu<b>gna, hamu kamar šl.in χʷl.a aǯaš, šl.i hič’i<b>k’nuš,... [UNCLEAR] ...hamrar.ika šl.in χʷl.a aǯaš aˁʁuˁ dap’nu uzuz χabar tuv.
unit.utterance_translation: Go to the village, this belt has disappeared, find out and let me know in whose house this silver belt is, who stole it, in whose (of those people) house it is.

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE] aχtːarmiš ap’i.
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE] Find out.

unit.utterance: aχtːarmiš ap’i.
unit.utterance_translation: Find out.

unit.utterance: afnu bačan.
unit.utterance_translation: Bachan came (back to Mezhgul).

unit.utterance: jiʁar.ikan sad jiʁ.an šulu ʁul.a sumčir.
unit.utterance_translation: One day there was a wedding in the village.

unit.utterance: sumčir abxigan, fu ligurva, šaˤjb.nan χpːir idi<b>t’u kamara, muk’a gehnaz zat’ adru, uˁlq’a ip’uz adru, idi<b>t’u kamara kabalčnu, značit lap χan.ǯin χpːir si ʁuˁru mu maˁrak.iz.
unit.utterance_translation: At the wedding, what do you see, Shaban's wife put on a belt, (the person) who never has anything, who even has no bread to eat, she put on the belt and decorated (herself), and goes to this feast like a khan's wife.

unit.utterance: bačan hamu laˁχn.ika χabar abxir diš šulu ʁaˁrac’an.ǯiz.
unit.utterance_translation: Having learnt of these happenings, Bachan rushes to Qaratsan.

unit.utterance: dušnu χabar tuvru rabadan.ǯiz.
unit.utterance_translation: (Bachan) went and told Rabadan the news.

unit.utterance: rabadan k’ur, kamar flanur.in χʷl.a aǯa.
unit.utterance_translation: He says: Rabadan, the belt is in the house of a such and such person.

unit.utterance: sarun, uzuz uvu aˁjdazuz, uvuzra uzu aˁjdaruz, fsʲo.
unit.utterance_translation: Fine, you don't know me, I don't know you, that's it. [= behave normal and don't tell anyone]

unit.utterance: hamcːi dupnu bačan qada<r>q’nu ʁuˁru.
unit.utterance_translation: Having spoken in this way, Bachan goes back.

unit.utterance: χabar abxi rabadan jiʁar.ikan sad jiʁ.an ʁuˁru maz̊glar.in ʁul.az.
unit.utterance_translation: Rabadan who learnt this news goes one day to the village of the Mezhgul people.

unit.utterance: qaˁbaˁqǯi sar.izq’a χabar adarǯi dufnu dusru šaˁjbn.an umbrar.in k’an.a.
unit.utterance_translation: In the evening, not having any more news, (Rabadan) came to Shaban's house and sat downstairs.

unit.utterance: hamus šaˤjban uduc̊’iš...
unit.utterance_translation: If Shaban goes out...

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE] hamu čan χanuk.rin?
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE] To his friend?

unit.utterance: ov, hamu čaq liχuz ʁafir u.
unit.utterance_translation: Yes, this one who came to him to work.

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE] ha liχuz ʁafir?
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE] But who came to work?

unit.utterance: ov, havan umbrar.in k’ana dusru uduc̊’uri jabnu jik’urza k’uri.
unit.utterance_translation: Yes, (he) sits at his stairs in order to hit him when he goes out, (he thinks,) I will kill him.

unit.utterance: rabadanna… rabadan vu, dimigan.ǯin čan ʁaˁracan.ǯi varič’a avtoritetnɨ admi rabadan u.
unit.utterance_translation: And Rabadan... Rabadan is, at that time Rabadan is a respectable man in his Qaratsan.

unit.utterance: ficːi abxnuš mu sar allah.ǯiz aˁǯu.
unit.utterance_translation: What happened, only Allah knows.

unit.utterance: ili havan baχtː.naan abxni, ili havan kefer adaǯi a<b>xi, ficːi abxnuš hamu jis̊.an šaˁjban č’atinǯi uduc̊’undar, aˁjan abxnuš aˁjdar.
unit.utterance_translation: Maybe Shaban was lucky or may be (he) wasn't in the mood, any way, somehow he did not go out into the yard that night, as if he knew.

unit.utterance: ficːi abxnuš sar.izq’a aˁjdar.
unit.utterance_translation: What happened, nobody knows.

unit.utterance: [UNCLEAR] ...anǯaχ mu uduc̊’undar.
unit.utterance_translation: Only he did not go out.

unit.utterance: hamu u<du>duc̊’ige rabadan.ǯi hap’ru, havan χaˁn.a aji q’uˁbeb jicra qaʔnu diš šulu...
unit.utterance_translation: Since he (Shaban) did not go out, what does Rabadan do, driving both oxen that were in his [= Shaban's] shed, he rushes out...

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE] ʁaˤrac’an.ǯiz.
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE] To Qaratsan.

unit.utterance: ʁaˁracan.ǯiz.
unit.utterance_translation: To Qaratsan.

unit.utterance: tabasaran.ǯiz ʁušur, muvu sab jic du<b>kːu tuvru mas.u, tabasaran ʁušnu... [UNCLEAR]
unit.utterance_translation: When he went to Tabasaran, he slaughters one ox and sells [the meat], he went to Tabasaran...

unit.utterance: havu pul ʁada<b>ʁu tmunu jicra qap’u aˁru düz χlaz.
unit.utterance_translation: He takes the money, and driving the other ox, he goes right home.

unit.utterance: [UNCLEAR] ...šulu, χabar šulu jicar du<r>gub.
unit.utterance_translation: (Shaban and his wife) realized that the oxen have disappeared.

unit.utterance: zamina ʁaravul nüraˤli vu.
unit.utterance_translation: Nurali was reliable guard.

unit.utterance: ǯa<r>ʁuru nüraˤl.ǯixna, wallah k’ur, sana jicar hič’ik’nu k’uri, χaˁna aji q’ubeb jicar.
unit.utterance_translation: (They) ran to Nurali and said that the oxen have been stolen, both of the oxen that were in the shed.

unit.utterance: daršul, haminǯi tinǯi, qa ix χʷl.az ʁafir fuž aǯa, fu ap’nu, fuž u.
unit.utterance_translation: (They) are gone, here and there, who was it that came to our house, what did they do, who was that?

unit.utterance: wallah k’ur, hamcːib laˤχin u.
unit.utterance_translation: Wallah, what kind of work this is.

unit.utterance: fikir ap’uru muvu, gizaf fu ap’uru, šl.ixa ap’uz šulu hacːib laˁχin.
unit.utterance_translation: He thought, he thought a lot, who could have done that work.

unit.utterance: anǯaχ k’ur, rabadan u k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Only Rabadan is (capable of doing that).

unit.utterance: diš šulu nüraˤli hamili... [UNCLEAR] ...düz ʁaˁrac’an.ǯiz.
unit.utterance_translation: Nurali rushed straight to Qaratsan.

unit.utterance: ov, hamura sabsi qu<r>q’ru hatmura.
unit.utterance_translation: Yes, this one, as well as another arrived.

unit.utterance: ǯaχ ap’ige rabadan, dupu ǯaχ ap’ige, uduc̊’uru muvan χpːir.
unit.utterance_translation: When (they) called Rabadan, when they called him, his wife went out.

unit.utterance: nüraˤli ʁaˁ<r>q:u χpːir.i mašar č’ur ap’uru.
unit.utterance_translation: When she saw Nurali, she made a grimace.

unit.utterance: haz ʁapiš, maz̊ʁlar.i hič’i<b>k’nu aˁχira.
unit.utterance_translation: Why? Because inhabitants of Mezhgul stole (the belt) after all.

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE] muvaz varidar.ika... [UNCLEAR] ...qaˁl ka[ǯa]?
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE] Is she angry at all (of them)?

unit.utterance: nu uže varidar.ika qaˤl kaǯa, maz̊gʷlar.ika.
unit.utterance_translation: Well, she is already angry at all (of them), at the inhabitants of Mezhgul.

unit.utterance: č’alk’a darpiǯi aˁra χʷl.az.
unit.utterance_translation: Without saying a word, she goes (back) to the house.

unit.utterance: rabadan.ǯiz ǯaχ ap’i k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: (They) said: Call Rabadan!

unit.utterance: uduc̊uru rabadan.
unit.utterance_translation: Rabadan goes out.

unit.utterance: haz ʁafuva, nüraˤli, k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Why have you come, Nurali? he said.

unit.utterance: havajinǯi ʁafuva, nüräli k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Have you come for a reason, Nurali?

unit.utterance: rabadan k’ur, jic adap’ haminǯi.
unit.utterance_translation: Rabadan, bring the ox out here!

unit.utterance: ha, havu sab, hatvu sab, havu sab, hatvu sab, rabadan, k’ur uxu uˁl dip’naxa k’ur, uzuz k’ur, jav derdi fu vuš aˁǯuzuz, jip k’ur fuvuš.
unit.utterance_translation: Well, this said one thing, that said another, this said more, that said another [i.e. they were arguing], he (Nurali) said: Rabadan, we have eaten bread together, I know what your problem is, say something!

unit.utterance: uzu k’ur jav derd.naq qu<r>q’unzu k’ur, jic adap’ haminǯi.
unit.utterance_translation: I can understand your problem, but bring the ox out here!

unit.utterance: aˁχir qa sanu rabadan.ǯin huˁ<b>ʁuˁdar... [UNCLEAR]
unit.utterance_translation: Finally, Rabadan lost his nerves.

unit.utterance: čav vujib aˁʁuˁ ʁabxnu sanu, ov, daršiš sanu mus̊.a šulajib ǯarab u, diminge zakonar hacːdar u.
unit.utterance_translation: (Nurali) learnt that it was (Rabadan) himself, that something else had happened, at that time the laws were like that.

unit.utterance: sanu čara šuldar rabadan.ǯiz, hamuva jic qap’u turu nüraˤl.ǯixna, qap’u dufu turu šaˁjb.naxna.
unit.utterance_translation: Rabadan did not have any choice, he brought out the ox and gave it to Nurali, and he [= Nurali] drove it and gave it to Shaban.

unit.utterance: qa he<r>χru, fu šuluʁ dap’nava uvu?
unit.utterance_translation: They ask (Shaban): What did you do?

unit.utterance: hap’u, qa minǯi tinǯi muvura k’ular gadaʁuru.
unit.utterance_translation: He [= Shaban] prevaricated and did not admit [the deed].

unit.utterance: vaʔ k’ur, rabadan.ǯi k’ur, jav jic hič’i<b>k’urudar k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: No, Rabadan would not steal your ox.

unit.utterance: uvu fu dap’naš jip k’ur!
unit.utterance_translation: Say what you have done!

unit.utterance: qa aškara šulu značit šaˁjb.nu liχuz ʁušuri... [UNCLEAR] ...kamar hič’i<b>k’nu du<b>χnajib.
unit.utterance_translation: Then it became clear that when Shaban had gone working, (he) had stolen the belt and brought it (home).

unit.utterance: ada<b>ʁu muvu, kamara tuvnu q’aˤlaˁq.
unit.utterance_translation: He took the belt out and gave it back.

unit.utterance: hatmu jic.ran pulla du<b>kːu... [UNCLEAR] ...tuvnu.
unit.utterance_translation: (Rabadan) gave the money (back) for that ox he slaughtered and sold.

unit.utterance: značit hamcːib jigitval, hamcːib ǯavabdarval ʁada<b>ʁura nüraˤl.ǯi maz̊glar.in... hamuvu, nüraˤli k’urur kas.ǯi maz̊gʷlar.in ʁul.a.
unit.utterance_translation: Nurali takes this courage, this responsibility among the people of Mezhgul, he the man called Nurali.

unit.utterance: hacːdar insanar axnu hamu maz̊gl.iin.
unit.utterance_translation: There were such people in this Mezhgul.
